page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY 3
page.content: A church was probably built on this ground in{920 A.D.,}but most of the present building,{ST. LAWRENCE,}dates from about{1230-1330.} It was built of Northamptonshire {ironstone}and has had several alterations inside. In the{South Aisle of the church, is the{CADAVER MONUMENT to the former rector - the{Archdeacon {WILLIAM SPONNE. }The East window celebrates Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee and the West window was dedicated in 1982 to Emily, the wife of Bertrand Moren M.B.E. The oldest of the{6 bells}in the{Tower}dates to 1612 and during restoration work, the remains of a{Roman pavement}were discovered under the floor. Other churches in Towcester include the{Roman Catholic Church(1845),}the {Baptist Chapel(1877)}and the{Methodist {Chapel (1893).
